page.title: 11Feldom Army Range
page.content: Feldom range is an area of 6000 acres, sheep and cattle graze there. Live ammunition is used and the farmer rounds up the sheep into safe enclosures. Army units from all over Britain shoot here for practice. Mr. Jameson is the warden in charge of the area. The army try and preserve birds habitats and the wild flowers, they have a team of people to help them who are geologists and archaeologists. A Bronze age village has been found and the site is not disturbed. There is a barrow and some cup and ring stones that no one in the world knows what they mean. They are also building a nesting box for a barn owl. We were escorted by Major Wilson and Colonel Le Mesurier.
